ygData.subject: RE: Verant ruined the revive line of spells
ygData.msgSnippet: Nope I got a level 50 cleric that trained and killled me resurect me.  I still had the same side affects for about 5 minutes.  Better then dying and losing a
ygData.messageBody:
Nope I got a level 50 cleric that trained and killled me resurect me. I
still had the same side affects for about 5 minutes. Better then dying and
losing a wholle bunch of hard earned exp.

> Ruben Alvarez
Field Service


-----Original Message-----
From: Mr. J Daniels [mailto:warpig@...]
Sent: Thursday, July 29, 1999 8:52 AM
To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Verant ruined the revive line of spells


From: "Mr. J Daniels" <warpig@...>

I agree, and lets not forget they are using the lowest level rez spell
available. Some of the side effects may decrease with higher level rez
spells.

Mr. J Daniels


On Thu, 29 Jul 1999, Lanadina the Magician wrote:

> From: "Lanadina the Magician" <lanadina@...>
>
> Can I be hypothetical here for a second?
>
> Imagine you are walking down the street, a car hits you, you die, and
> miraculously, a doctor is able to revive you and bring you back to life!
Are
> you going to have full health? No way! Are you going to be extremely weak?

> You betcha!
>
> Granted, it was a REALLY nice thing to be able to be resurrected and have
> your full mana and HP on your character, and being ready to go after you
> loot, but if EQ is about Roleplaying, and about trying to be
semi-realistic
> in some cases, ressurect was not broken in the last patch, but instead, it
